articles.title: Rethinking Human Ancestry: New Study Challenges Homo naledi Burial Claims - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Recent research challenges the assertions that Homo naledi, an ancient human relative with a smaller brain dating back to 335-241,000 years ago, intentionally buried their deceased and created rock art in Rising Star Cave, South Africa. Three pre-print articl…
articles.content: A recent study challenges previous claims that Homo naledi, a species dating back to between 335-241,000 years ago, deliberately buried their dead and created rock art in Rising Star Cave, South Afri… [+3638 chars]

articles.title: Saldanha Bay and Langebaan Lagoon - nasa.gov
articles.description: This coastal stretch of South Africa’s Western Cape province supports industry, fishing, farming, tourism, and a nature reserve.
